intro: Aphanostephus, commonly known as the ghost grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with slender, grass-like leaves. The plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Aphanostephus species are known for their small, inconspicuous flowers that often go unnoticed. Due to their limited distribution and specialized habitats, they are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
